## Highlights as CSV

```{r}
#| echo = T
noise <- read.csv(
    file = "data-raw/2023-07-30_noise_highlights.csv",
    stringsAsFactors = F
    )
noise[1:5, 1:5]
```

## Noise Quote

```{r something}
#| echo: true

library(tidyverse)
noise |> 
    select(quote) |> 
    filter(grepl("MSE", quote))
```

# Conclusion

To preserve your reading efforts:

- Your public library is a valuable resource.
- The Libby app allows for exporting of annotations.
- Choose a highlighting strategy.
- Export and play with your data.
